meanings.sent1: He snookered his friend into believing the fake story.
meanings.sent2: The con artist snookered many people with his scams.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy snookered his sister into thinking she had superpowers.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox snookered the rabbit with a clever disguise.
meanings.sent5: The magician snookered the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: To be in a difficult or impossible situation
meanings.sent1: She felt snookered when she realized she forgot her keys inside the locked house.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was snookered when he lost his map in the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: I was snookered when I got stuck in traffic on the way to the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: The team was snookered when their star player got injured right before the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The detective felt snookered when all the evidence pointed to the wrong suspect.

meanings.definition: To be obstructed or blocked in progress
meanings.sent1: The construction was snookered by the unexpected storm.
meanings.sent2: The project was snookered by budget cuts halfway through.
meanings.sent3: The delivery was snookered by a road closure due to a parade.
meanings.sent4: Her plans were snookered by a sudden illness.
meanings.sent5: The investigation was snookered by lack of cooperation from key witnesses.
